ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A set of predicates and assertions for checking the properties of variables, such as length, names and attributes.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages.  End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.

A set of predicates and assertions for checking the properties of variables, such as length, names and attributes.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages.  End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.

name: r-assertive.properties
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.0-5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-assertive.properties
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/assertive.properties_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/assertive.properties/assertive.properties_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b68954f53082561f0242682611bf3373e0bf30d8ac2256d82474edc5f992f4dd

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-assertive.base >=0.0_7
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-assertive.base >=0.0_7

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('assertive.properties')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('assertive.properties')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://bitbucket.org/richierocks/assertive.properties
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: A set of predicates and assertions for checking the properties of variables, such as length, names and attributes.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages.  End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
